title: PlayWise Hardware v1 Development Kit Specification

# PlayWise v1 Development Kit Specification

## Overview
This specification defines the hardware components and assembly requirements for the PlayWise v1 development kit, designed to enable rapid prototyping and data collection for the AI-powered educational toy.

## Core Requirements

### Computing Platform
- Raspberry Pi 4B 4GB
- 32GB MicroSD minimum (Class 10)
- Ubuntu/Raspberry Pi OS compatible

### Power System
- Input: 5V 3A USB-C
- Battery: 5000mAh LiPo
- Runtime: 4+ hours
- Safety: Over-voltage, over-current protection
- Temperature monitoring

### Sensor Package
1. Motion Detection
   - MPU-6050 6-axis accelerometer/gyroscope
   - 16-bit precision
   - I2C interface

2. User Input
   - 4x capacitive touch sensors
   - Minimal latency (<20ms)
   - Moisture resistant

3. Audio System
   - Stereo speaker output
   - USB microphone input
   - 44.1kHz sampling rate

4. Visual System
   - Raspberry Pi Camera V2
   - 8MP resolution
   - 1080p30 video capability

## Development Features

### Debug Interface
- GPIO breakout access
- USB logic analyzer support
- Temperature monitoring points
- Power consumption measurement

### Safety Considerations
1. Thermal Management
   - Maximum surface temperature: 35Â°C
   - Thermal pad placement
   - Ventilation requirements

2. Power Safety
   - Battery protection circuit
   - Safe charging implementation
   - Emergency shutdown capability

### Data Collection Capabilities
1. Sensor Data
   - Motion patterns
   - Touch interactions
   - Audio recordings
   - Visual tracking

2. System Metrics
   - Power consumption
   - Temperature profiles
   - Performance statistics
   - Error logging

## Assembly Guidelines

### Physical Construction
- 3D printed shell design
- Easy access to components
- Minimal sharp edges
- Drop resistance (1m)

### Wiring Requirements
- Standardized connectors
- Strain relief on cables
- Clear labeling
- EMI considerations

## Testing Requirements

1. Power System
   - Battery life verification
   - Charging cycles
   - Temperature monitoring

2. Sensor Integration
   - Calibration procedures
   - Response time testing
   - Accuracy verification

3. Data Collection
   - Storage capacity
   - Transfer speeds
   - Data integrity

### Safety Testing

- Electrical safety
